alert.note: Alert for Baker; Calhoun; Clay; Dougherty; Early; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:23PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Henry County in southeastern Alabama, western Dougherty, Clay, southern Randolph, northern Baker, Calhoun, Early and southwestern Terrell Counties in southwestern Georgia through 715 PM EDT/615 PM CDT/... At 623 PM EDT/523 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles north of Fort Gaines to 8 miles northwest of Edison to near Shellman. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Morgan, Blakely, Cuthbert, Dawson, Edison, Arlington, Shellman, Leary, Walker, Douglasville, Damascus, Bellville, Haleburg, Bluffton, Shorterville, Iveys Mill, Parksville and Carnegie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Calhoun; Clay; Dougherty; Early; Randolph; Terrell
